data.text: @trevorm39 @DrMVanderpump @DrHoenderkamp That’s a very old fashion way of dieting that doesn’t work in the long run. Majority will lose the weight and will go back to their way of eating and put it all back on and some more, because that kind of diet isn’t sustainable.

@Nelly1899 @DrMVanderpump @DrHoenderkamp Snap!
Swap unhealthy snacks with 6-8 individual nuts - que? Who does that? I scoff the whole pack with a nice glass of wustick wed.
Do not drink alcohol - no way!
Stand up while watching TV - ?
The point he doesn't address is the role of the sheer volume of crap fat people eat.

@DrMVanderpump All common sense stuff. Eat less, exercise more. Simples. Healthy options have never been so plentiful and cheap. Unfortunately, neither have unhealthy ones. There was almost no obesity when I was kid in the 60s & 70s.

@DrMVanderpump @DrHoenderkamp Basically stop enjoying life all together. Watch TV while standing up? Cut out all carbs no alcohol +all the non sustainable diet tips. We know this kind of diet doesn’t work in the long run. I did lose 5 stone successfully many years ago and kept it off without torturing myself.

@DrMVanderpump I miss vitamin D supplementation. Obese people are prone to vitamin D deficiency because it is fat soluble. Vitamin D appears to play an important role as protection against severe covid.
